::: {.cell}

:::


::: {.cell}

:::

This page provides information about the valid indicative distribution map for the ecosystem functional group [**F2.4 Freeze-thaw freshwater lakes**](/efg-info/F2_4.qmd). For older or alternative maps, see [here](/map-info/F2_4_history.qmd).

## Methods

Here is the methods summary for **Map code and version**: F2.4.web.mix v1.0.

> Location of small and large natural lakes was taken from the HydroLAKES database (types 1 an 3 in Messager et al. 2016). We included all lakes with minimum temperature below 0Â°C (Linke et al. 2019). Occurrences were aggregated to ten minute spatial resolution.

::: {.cell}

:::



::: {.cell}

:::



### Datasets

**HydroAtlas-1.0** (Linke et al. 2019):

Source of _Hydrography_.
 Resolution: <1km2, static.
 Accuracy evaluation: derived from sources.

 **HydroLAKES-1.0** (Messager et al. 2016):

Source of _validated distribution records_.
 Resolution: <1km2, static.
 Accuracy evaluation: quantitative (subsets).

::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}


|dataset        |url                                                          |
|:--------------|:------------------------------------------------------------|
|HydroAtlas-1.0 |<https://www.hydrosheds.org/page/hydroatlas>{target='links'} |
|HydroLAKES-1.0 |<https://www.hydrosheds.org/page/hydrolakes>{target='links'} |


:::
:::

### Processing

Processing steps used in this map are: *Thresholds* :: *Reclassification*.

### Map evaluation


This map is considered to be a ***Medium quality map*** based on the following characteristics:

Concept alignment is *Direct,general*.

Ground observations are _NA_.

 The accuracy evaluation *Compiled from reputable source data,documented,quantitative,derived from sources*.

## How to use the data

### Available files

:::{.aside}

Following maps are considered current and valid indicative distribution maps for this ecosystem functional group. `Web navigation` maps are optimised for use in webapps, but they have similar methods and differ only in details of format and processing. 

- Indicative Map (**code: F2.4.IM.mix**, version v1.0) 
 - Web navigation (**code: F2.4.web.mix**, version v1.0) 


:::

You can download geospatial data for this map from the following sources:

**F2.4.IM.mix** (v1.0): [Google Cloud bucket](gs://iucn_get_l3_im/F2.4.IM.mix_v1.0.tif){target="gisdata"} :: [Zenodo repository (bundle of maps)](http://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.3958934){target="gisdata"}

**F2.4.web.mix** (v1.0): [Google Cloud bucket](gs://iucn_get_l3_im/F2.4.web.mix_v1.0.tif){target="gisdata"} :: [Zenodo repository (bundle of maps)](http://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.5090419){target="gisdata"} :: [Zenodo repository (EFG map)](https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.5090949){target="gisdata"} :: [Mapbox tileset](https://studio.mapbox.com/tilesets/jrfep.F2_4_web_mix){target="gisdata"} :: [Earth Engine assets](projects/earthengine-legacy/assets/users/jrferrerparis/IUCN-GET/L3_IndMaps/){target="gisdata"}

Note that you need to login to some services like [mapbox](https://www.mapbox.com){target="links"} or [earthengine](https://earthengine.google.com){target="links"}, and in some cases you also need to request access to the files.

###  License information

Indicative maps have been released with a ![](https://zenodo.org/static/icons/licenses/cc-by-icon.svg){height=20} Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International license. 

Datasets used to create this map have similar licenses, but please check the license information below.


::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}


|dataset        |license_info                                                                                                  |
|:--------------|:-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|HydroAtlas-1.0 |http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/ :: Creative Commons Attribution (CC-BY) 4.0 International License |
|HydroLAKES-1.0 |Creative Commons Attribution (CC-BY) 4.0 International License :: http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/ |


:::
:::

## References

References used in this version of the maps.

- Messager, M.L., Lehner, B., Grill, G., Nedeva, I., Schmitt, O.  (2016) *Estimating the volume and age of water stored in global lakes using a geo-statistical approach* **Nature Communications** 13603 [DOI:10.1038/ncomms13603](http:dx.doi.org/10.1038/ncomms13603) 
 - Linke, S., Lehner, B., Ouellet Dallaire, C., Ariwi, J., Grill, G., Anand, M., Beames, P., Burchard-Levine, V., Maxwell, S., Moidu, H., Tan, F., Thieme, M.  (2019) *Global hydro-environmental sub-basin and river reach characteristics at high spatial resolution* **Scientific Data** 6: 283 [DOI:10.1038/s41597-019-0300-6](http:dx.doi.org/10.1038/s41597-019-0300-6)
